intro: Homalium longistylum, commonly known as the long-styled huito, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by fleshy, orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
